sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: China's Xi Jinping touches down in Moscow for three days of talks with President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A trip Beijing claims will facilitate friendship, cooperation and peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping has touched down in Moscow ahead of talks with Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Beijing has called the visit a journey of friendship aimed at playing a constructive role in promoting peace talks over the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: role in promoting peace talks over the war in Ukraine. It comes after China scored a major diplomatic victory by helping restore ties between arch rivals Saudi Arabia and Iran.

sentences.sentence: They do want to affirm the strategic partnership with the Russian Federation to show that America's attempts to split the relationship and make the relationship costly for China will not work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They want to show the developing world that they can play a constructive role. They want to avoid economic and reputational costs in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yet hours after the announcement of the trip, an international arrest warrant for Putin was declared, accusing him of the deportation of Ukrainian children. The White House has said Russia would use a ceasefire in Ukraine to rebuild and refresh their forces so that they can restart attacks at a time of their choosing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But experts say Xi's visit is unlikely to have any drastic impact on the course of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The European Central Bank has announced a coordinated move with five other big central banks to ensure liquidity and prevent a global banking crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The ECB, the banks of Canada, England and Japan, the US Federal Reserve and the Swiss National Bank intend to alleviate market tensions and ensure credit supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Markets remain jittery despite the best efforts of regulators to restore calm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Fears of an escalating banking crisis loom large following the financial problems suffered by the embattled Credit Suisse Group and the bankruptcy of Silicon Valley Bank in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After losing 25% of its stock market value last week, the Swiss authorities urged banking giant UBS to buy its rival UBS agreed and announced it would take on the group for a sum of 3 billion euros the Swiss government has welcomed the deal and says the collapse of Credit Suisse would lead to incalculable consequences for the country and the international financial system The French government will face two motions of no confidence in response to President Macron's decision to bypass parliament to push through his unpopular pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If the no confidence votes win the majority, the pension bill will be nullified and Prime Minister Elizabeth Bourne would have to resign, forcing President Macron to appoint a new government or call for early elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Given the lack of public and political support for the bill, as demonstrated in the weeks of protests and strikes which have seen tons of rubbish pile up in Paris, the French government invoked Article 49.3 as they were not guaranteed to win a majority in the National Assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Transport strikes continue today and a ninth day of walkouts has been proposed by unions for this Thursday.
